Malaysia police does not follow the law.Cartoonist Zunar wins RM18,000 in damages over book seizureKUALA LUMPUR: Political cartoonist Zunar (pic) won RM18,000 in damages for his claim against the Government and four others over the seizure of 66 copies of his book "Cartoon-O-Phobia" and a cartoon artwork in 2010.Speaking to reporters after the proceedings in chambers on Tuesday, Federal counsel Safiyyah Omar confirmed that High Court deputy registrar K.Pavani recorded the consent judgment between the parties during the assessment of damages.When met by media later, Zunar said it is not about the quantum of damages but a lesson to the police and the Government that using criminal law to confiscate cartoon books and artwork and hold on to them for five years was unacceptable.Read more at http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...ABhBQ4ZWss0D.99

Presumably...1. Someone reports you to a mod about 'malicious comment'.2. Moderator files report with cops/MCMC3. IO opens case. Forward screenshot of said comment with application for warrant to court.4. Court obliges, and Tencent is forced to give away your ISP and/or phone number.5. One day, you foUnd your face in the pavement as you get cuffed and hauled into the party van.

They have absolutely no right to check your phones as no such act is found as noted in the Red Book. And as far as I know, no act has been drafted regarding this. Hell, they have no right to bring you to police station unless you are arrested, and in this case they have to note carefully which AKTA they are using.
